chargeHist.descr: Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st or 2nd Degree Sexual Assault)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Erik M Herron was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Incest with Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.06(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st or 2nd Degree Sexual Assault)

superMiscConds.notes: If probation/extended supervision is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Defendant shall not possess/consume any controlled substance without a valid prescription.

Defendant shall not enter establishments whose primary purpose is the sale/serving of alcohol.

Defendant shall have no contact with any female under 14yrs old without prior agent approval.

Defendant shall have no direct or indirect contact with his sister MAH, except as allowed by agent.

Defendant shall not possess/use any pornographic or sexually explicit material.

Defendant shall not possess/use any computer or technical device, including a cell phone with Internet capability, without prior written approval of agent.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling, assessments and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent, including Sex Offender treatment and any follow-up.

Defendant shall provide DNA sample.

Defendant shall take all medication as prescribed, and only as prescribed.  

Defendant shall comply with the Sex Offender Registry.

Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.

Defendant shall obtain/maintain full-time employment, schooling, or combination of both.

Addendum; Sealed

Def appears in custody & w/Atty John P. Kuczmarski.  Atty Stephanie L Hanson for State.  Clerk: CP.  Victim's mother also present in court.  PSI author not present at this time.  Statement from A.S.  PSI has been reviewed.  Statements from counsel.  Recess.  Reconvene.  PSI author now present; addendum to PSI filed.  Court questions PSI author.  Recess.  Reconvene.  Court questions def; def requests to proceed w/sentencing.  PSI addendum has been reviewed.  Argument from State and counsel.  Statement from S.P.  Statement from def.  Court proceeds to sentencing.
Presentence Report e-mailed to DA's office & defense counsel
Disposition Form
Sentencing hearing on January 7, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Def appears in custody & w/Atty John P. Kuczmarski.  Atty Stephanie L Hanson for State.  Clerk: CP.  Victim's aunt present in court.  State moves to dismiss and read-in Ct 1; Court so orders.  On Ct 2 State recommends Pre-Sentence Investigation w/both sides free to argue.  Def enters guilty plea to Ct 2.  Court finds def guilty on Ct 2 and orders Pre-Sentence Investigation.  Court keeps previuosly imposed bond in place.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 7, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Victim does not request to be present for hearings
Hearing on October 22, 2014 at 08:15 am.

Def appears in custody & w/Atty John P. Kuczmarski.  Atty Stephanie L Hanson for State. Also present is Def's mother.  Review of NGI report, same has been reviewed by defense; Defense & State do not contest the findings.  State files Victims' Rights Information.  Defense anticipates entering plea on the adjourned date.  Hearing scheduled for October 22, 2014 at 08:15 am.

Order for Examination Under 971.16 (Not Guilty by Reason of Mental Disease or Defect)
Hearing on October 17, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Def appears in custody & w/Atty John P. Kuczmarski.  Atty Sandra Jo Giernoth for State.  Clerk: CP.  Review of competency report.  Report finds def competent to proceed; def and State do not object to finding.  Def waives preliminary hearing.  Court questions def and accepts waiver.  Def enters NGI plea.  Court appoints Dr Pankiewicz to do examination.  Hearing scheduled for October 17, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Order for Competency Examination by Department of Health Services

Per WI Forensic Unit, specific Dr cannot be ordered to do competency evaluation (Dr is assigned based on a rotation schedule); no new ordered needed - they will assign Dr per procedure. DA and counsel notified via phone.
No contact with MAH or her residence or anywhere she is residing
Hearing on September 10, 2014 at 01:15 pm.

Def appears in custody & w/Atty John Kuczmarski of  State Public Defenders Office.  Atty Stephanie L Hanson for State.  Clerk: CP.    Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  Counsel will be requesting competency hearing.  Court sets $7500 cash bond.  Def waives time limits on preliminary hearing; Court accepts waiver.  Court orders competency report be prepared by Dr Pankiewicz.  Adjourned for competency eval.  Hearing scheduled for September 10, 2014 at 01:15 pm.
